page.title: 02Employment. Work in Chepstow
page.content: In the last century work in Chepstow concentrated around a very busy port, exporting oak, bark, timber etc. and importing wine. With the decline of the port most work for local people is provided by Chepstow Hospitals, Dendix brushes and Fairfield-Mabey. They employ together approx. 1,150 local people. Fairfield-Mabey manufacture steel- work for bridges. Fairfield built the Severn Bridge.They sell their products in the U.K. 99% of their raw materials are supplied by British Steel. Dendix employ 220.They manufacture ski-slopes, golf-mats and industrial brushes.Their products are sold World wide,their raw materials are bought in the U.K. Chepstow Hospitals employ about 720 staff mostly from the Chepstow area. {Unemployment in this area is about 15%
